_header: Awake sinner out of thy sleep
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 230; cf. Stevens (1961)
XStevens, John. Music and Poetry in the Early Tudor Court. London: Methuen, 1961, 106.

CamPem314.First Lines:
Awake synner out of thi slepe……[ ] a mayd to haue
                    concepcion [ ] and eue es one[ ]macyon man is come man[ ] except
                    syne…
CamPem314.Last Lines:
…Blissid mary modyr of graceIwen of comforte and pytygret
                    was þi care with owt solasWhen þat þu wyst thy sone xuld
                    dye& from [the] gooThow sayd alas þis sory caceWhat xal
                    I dooIhesu þi sone man born of theWas Iugged & rent & all
                    for [ ]……but faythe she with adam was made and eue [ ] gen[
                    ]cyon[ ] by his in carnacyonman is com man here to [ ][ ] as we
                    wer he is excep synneNoua noua istam [ ]m serua
CamPem314.Note:
Two fragments of paper leaf, once used as pastedowns. Musical
                    notation.
